fields.summary: failed to set up device mapper table with dmsetup

comments.body:
[~dmitrii] while speaking to [~prabhav] on IRC #eucalyptus freenode it appears to be the same problem as EUCA-10384 but on 4.0.2

In her case the backing filesystem is ext3 but only workaround she could found which is not feasible is to terminate instances and manually clear the device mapper state. Infact in her case even the loopback devices didn't get clear up.

This is hitting us on field badly today. 4.0.2 and 4.1.0 both have this bug. Can we please make sure some quick progress is made on this one and an acceptable workaround can be formed. There should be way to identify and clear old and unused stuff instead of all of the artifacts that requires clearing all instances out of the NC in question.

Hope the above makes sense please let me know if you have any questions.

Hi Deependra
     Thanx for sharing my request.I have the sosreport from CLC and NC( because both are same machines).Here is the link
https://www.dropbox.com/s/glpqvpkya229p5f/sosreport-prabha.10561-20150216180843.tar.xz?dl=0

Please have a look on it
Thanks, [~dshekhawat]. Do we have any idea how to reproduce this ourselves?

Hi [~prabhav] please arrange a remote screen sharing session to help us troubleshoot this issue further. Can you arrange it sometime today ? I hope you can easily reproduce this problem on any given NC in your setup. If so please provide remote screen sharing session (teamviewer etc.) on this ticket to move forward.

Hi deependra
   Thanx for your support..I shall send you the teamviewer id through mail
Thanks [~prabhav] I am still waiting. Are you sure you can reproduce the problem again easily ? If so lets go ahead with teamviewer.

Dear Deependra
  Again I getting the same issue on launching new VM
backing.c:206                     | blobstore: error: blobstore.c:3679 failed to set up device mapper table with 'dmsetup'
My team viewer id 832 108 437
Password- wrs978

Sorry deependra
  There was some issue with teamviewer.I have restarted the service
  ID is the same 
  Password 684kdg

Hi Deependra

Same error as before

ERROR 000014564 partition_creator        | [i-42f343d3] failed to clone euca-zero device into partition: 12 blobstore.c:3537 failed to remove device mapper device with 'dmsetup'
ERROR 000014564 art_implement_tree       | [i-42f343d3] failed to create artifact prt-15360ext3-cf8ffe81 (error=1, may retry) on try 1

Thanks for the session today. I have understood your use case and the
problem in detail. I will providing summary to the problem here shortly so
we can get moving forward with this. Stay tuned.

Cheers,
Deependra

On Wed, Feb 18, 2015 at 12:30 PM, prabha (JIRA) <

Hi [~dmitrii],

I worked with [~prabhav] and we found strange behaviour on the NC when the instances are manually destroyed using virsh. It appears that when you have destroyed an instance using {{virsh destroy}} on a NC where the instance was created using eucalyptus the NC does not cleanup artifacts in /var/lib/eucalyptus/instances/work/* for that instance. This is strange because in the labs we do not see this behaviour.

Once the instance is destroyed the NC, CC and CLC has forgotten about it and CLC marks it as terminated. Now [~prabhav] was able to bring this instance back to life by simply doing {{virsh create instance-libvirt.xml}} from inside the instance work directory. This was because the NC didn't clean these artifacts at the first place when the instance was destroyed. {{virsh create}} brought the instance back online and then we did a restart of NC service. Now interestingly the NC tries to delete the artifacts belonging to the instance we destroyed and created outside of Eucalyptus using {{virsh}} but failed to do so. Eventually it ends up adopting the instance and shows the state of the instance as {{EXTANT}}. This goes back to the CC and we can see in the cc.log that it has been getting information about this instance in {{doDescribeInstances}}. CLC however does not have any idea about this instance and hence no instance restore path was executed here.

Meanwhile now the NC has reached in a state where no new instances will run on it. They all fail to get launched with the error as mentioned in this title of this BUG. I am not sure how that occurs but certainly in a failure test like this we would expect NC to do the right thing from the beginning.

Also with the same release of Eucalyptus here i.e. 4.0.2 I was unable to reproduce the problem in the exact same manner. So I am wondering if [~prabhav] has done any code changes in the Eucalyptus NC code to make sure the artifacts are not deleted after the instance is gone. That would explain the scenario , I say this because I saw [~prabhav] running Eucalyptus inside {{/opt/eucalyptus/}} and having the NC source code files open in another terminal.

Cheers,
Deependra

Deependra..
    I didnot modify the source code of euca.Actually I did the installation in /opt/eucalyptus for the reason I was planning to build a deb package using this, as we are doing the experiment in debian and both xen and kvm.
   Otherthan that I was just viewing the source code but didnot modify anything.

Cheers
Prabha
Thanks [~prabhav] for the clarification this will help engineering move forward with the root cause analysis and if there is any issue in Eucalyptus we should be able to fix it.

Deependra 
    Today when I was working with the setup even if I dont terminate the instance too after some time it is giving the same dmsetup error when I try to launch the instance.What could be the issue?
I have no idea [~prabhav] but it looks like we might have some lead on reproduction of the issue by [~hspencer] that can help [~dmitrii] fix the bug here.

Hey [~prabhav],

Would you mind doing the following:

* Set the log level to TRACE on your NC (set  {{LOGLEVEL=TRACE}} in /etc/eucalyptus/eucalyptus.conf file)
* Installing the [eucalyptus sosreport plugin|https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus-sosreport-plugins/releases/download/v0.1.7/eucalyptus-sos-plugins-0.1.7-0.el6.x86_64.rpm] on your NC that is experiencing the issue.
* Provide a link to where the sosreport can be downloaded, and the instance ID that produces the dmsetup error on the NC

Thanks for this.  We greatly appreciate your help.

hi harold
This is the link
https://www.dropbox.com/s/glpqvpkya229p5f/sosreport-prabha.10561-20150216180843.tar.xz?dl=0

One thing what I have noted is that the problem not only arises after euca-terminate-instance,it actually comes after restarting the NC service itself.
